channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: I’d love to see a comparative reading of this, contemporary haredi miracle working, and the situation in American Pentecostal Christianity. https://t.co/desAXNasST
@lavietidhar Frankly, as long as people buy books, who cares what people do with them?
@froomkin @nytopinion Here’s some questions from the left I’d love to see them address. https://t.co/T8iks5WfYC

Given that land in the American colonies was given out in part based on how many slaves colonists brought with them, immigrating to America in the colonial era strongly selected for those without moral qualms, and being an established 18th century landholder more so. https://t.co/jAKmv2R7OC
Founding fathers may have been typical of their fellow children of the initial generation of slaver colonists in their moral judgements, but that’s hardly a fair reflection of the state of 18th century moral philosophy.

@prof_dainy @MisfitTorah The great thing about having ancestors who passed through the bottleneck of 19th century West Point, Georgia, is we know our sixth cousins because they’re also our fourth and second cousins.

Incidentally, how come no one has made the connection between the covid mageifa (plague) and the infiltration of Orthodox Judaism by the MAGA movement? Seems more solid than blaming earthquakes on Jewish cartoonists. https://t.co/w93BpHGly8
@scalzi A quarter of the way through. I do hope there’s an explanation for your violation of pretty explicit internationally agreed upon secrecy protocols.

Oh, I loved my Smith Corona. https://t.co/y5dgnt9Drk
Not this pinwheel, though. A basic model somewhat like this with ink and and eraser cartridges my parents bought me around the time of my bar mitzvah. By the time a key broke a decade later, I had moved on to my Osborne. https://t.co/PUb8eQJmZG
Luckily, mainstream news outlets are sparing readers from uncomfortable weird feelings by not highlighting this fact. https://t.co/yVWUWicknJ
@abbaleh @kampeas There’s a book for that: https://t.co/GkwluTeeQG
@trekonomics The good thing about SCOTUS legalizing open carry nationwide in 2024 is that armed pedestrians will make for polite drivers.
Similarly true regarding engagement with antisemitism reports vs Jewish culture on my newspaper’s Facebook page. https://t.co/zAeME9zlKz
Why is there only one Star Trek / Mission Impossible crossover on https://t.co/fQ2QvB2IkI? https://t.co/TcEO1IM6xV
@newrepublic Seems like it’s time to start putting some @LogCabinGOP on the record about all this.
@MichaelVilain @doctorow The key is the hydrogen and oxygen. It’s in the name.
Career advice: Unix knowledge often pays financial dividends. https://t.co/FmjmfTAeJK

@michaelkivi @stevesilberman @Saldasoro I wonder if this influence Dylan’s decision to sail the Carribean a couple years later, where he wrote much of what became Infidels as detailed in Surviving in a Ruthless World. https://t.co/LmPgAuhWVH
@michaelkivi @stevesilberman @Saldasoro Also gives a whole new meaning to “Yacht Rock.”
@MisfitTorah No, that’s the Church of Tammuz.

One of the fun things about writing for the @jewishstandard, which serves a broadly-based Jewish community which includes a strong YU-centered component, is that while I begin with a reminder of what korban pesach is, I can recount halachic pilpul before I end. https://t.co/DxZdXHFQ7C
@JewishStandard Also, eternally grateful to my publisher for ignoring consultants who repeatedly preached the doctrine of "shorter is better," which leads to New York Time-style articles that skim the surface but always frustrate people who know the deeper story.
God endorses Hamm? Big news for Jews if true. https://t.co/Tr3xkvtXUL
@RVAwonk Good thing the Democrats decided that fighting the culture wars would scare swing voters!
@Mr_Electrico Can’t think of a nicer person to be stalked by an ex.
@DavidRSelis Inevitable result of the yeshivish velt embracing magaland. No such thing as MAGA im Derech Eretz.

“We, too, have been living through years of rising waters,” says the man in denial about global warming. https://t.co/ZUcwlm9F6F
Pretty sure that YU's new vice provost dressed as a clown at my Purim seudah some 37 year ago.
That should help her relate to her Bret when she discusses religious freedom with him next month.
https://t.co/XxG28KS7jj
@trekonomics “We, too, have been living through years of rising waters.” -- Wait until he hears about global warming!
